Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory4.jpg'}
{1: 'RImgBg1Shake'}
{3: 'The aftermath of the explosion launches rubble into the air as the last remaining Corrupted signals flashing on the terminal are completely annihilated.'}
{2: 'System', 3: 'All Corrupted signals in Zone C are gone. Joint eradication mission complete.'}
{2: 'System', 3: 'Calculating casualties. ETE for the transport craft is twenty minutes. Remain in position and await extraction.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryTongxunHalfNew.prefab', 3: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lucia', 3: "The transport craft has arrived. Commandant, how's your situation?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Return according to plan.', 3: '14'}
{2: "I'll return with the other commandants.", 3: '15'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: 'Understood. See you soon, Commandant.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Thanks for your work.', 3: '17', 4: 'See you soon.', 5: '17'}
{2: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryTongxunHalfNew.prefab', 4: '1'}
{3: 'After terminating the comm link, your nerves finally relax a bit. You lean against the wall and sigh gently. The fatigue accumulated from battle begins to surface.'}

{3: 'Several other commandants participating in this mission also return to the temporary headquarters one after another to confirm the mission with their own team through their respective comm links.'}
{3: "Suddenly, everyone's terminal rings at the same time."}
{2: 'System', 3: 'Emergency alert.'}

{2: 'System', 3: 'A commandant performing a mission in Zone C has issued an emergency support request. Construct, Model No. BPH-22, has reached critical M.I.N.D. deviation. She is in urgent need of a commandant connection.'}
{2: 'System', 3: 'Repeat. Model No. BPH-22...'}
{2: '(That designation is...)'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Commandant A', 3: 'A Construct has gone haywire?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Commandant B', 3: 'How could this happen at a time like this...? What about the acting commandant?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Commandant C', 3: "That model number sounds familiar. Is it that white Construct from Cerberus...? What's she called...", 4: '3'}

{2: 'Commandant A', 3: 'Cerberus... Those "Rabid Dogs" are an experimental combat team. I heard their commandant is a fella who can\'t fight boots on the ground and relies solely on remote M.I.N.D. connections.', 4: '1'}

{2: 'Commandant B', 3: "Remote links? But once a connection is severed, that'll overload the Construct and take forever to re-calibrate. No wonder they're asking for emergency ground support.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Commandant C', 3: 'Once, I was on a recovery mission in the same area as Cerberus. Their way of fighting...', 4: '3'}
{3: "The commandant with short brown hair shakes his head and shrugs as if remembering something he didn't want to recall."}
{3: '"The white Construct from Cerberus"...'}
{2: 'Commandant C', 3: '...Seems like a nightmare to control. Connecting with a remote link runs a huge risk of overloading their M.I.N.D.', 4: '3'}
{2: 'Commandant B', 3: "I still have some work to finish. I can't sever my link with my team members just yet.", 4: '2'}
{3: 'The alert on your tactical terminal continues to ring. You suddenly recall your last link with No. 21.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgCg/Cg2001_5.jpg'}
{3: 'Broken and wounded. Jaw trembling. Gray pupils, fierce and alert.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory4.jpg'}
{2: "Leave it to me. I'm free now.", 3: '55'}
{1: '1', 3: "Without any hesitation, you send a signal to confirm support and immediately proceed to No. 21's position marked on the map."}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory5.jpg'}
{3: 'Despite not bringing a remote connection device on the mission, you reach the distance required to establish a proximity connection as fast as your exoskeleton allows.'}
{3: "No. 21's is vibrantly displayed nearby on your terminal."}
{1: '1', 3: 'Amid the flurry of dust and smoke, you see a white figure with a murderous glare in her eyes.'}
{3: 'As if throwing fatigue and emotions into the wind, the Construct commands her Co-Bot to relentless attack the already indistinguishable remains of Corrupted.'}
{3: "You can tell at a glance that the Construct is beyond reasoning with. If she doesn't calm down soon, she may overload her M.I.N.D. due to being unable to control her power."}
{2: '(Approach)', 3: '65', 4: '(Attempt to connect)', 5: '65'}
{3: 'You put the tranquilizer gun back into your tactical belt, raising your hands as you slowly approach No. 21.'}
{3: 'Aware that someone is approaching, No. 21 tenses her frame like a wounded little beast and roars menacingly.'}
{2: "I'm not your enemy.", 3: '68'}
{2: 'No. 21', 3: 'Mission... Destroy... Death...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Your mission is over.', 3: '70'}
{2: "There aren't any Corrupted signals nearby.", 3: '72'}
{3: 'After quite some time, it seems that No. 21 regains some semblance of clarity amidst the chaos, then robotically halts her struggle.'}
{3: 'She slowly looks at the scattered remains of the Corrupted, then looks back at you.'}
{2: "If you keep this up, you'll overload your M.I.N.D.", 3: '79'}
{2: 'I want to establish a M.I.N.D. connection with you.', 3: '80'}
{3: "She doesn't seem to be as confused, nor does she show a strong opposition to the proposal."}
{2: 'System', 3: 'Link established.'}
{2: '(Calibrating M.I.N.D.)', 3: '86'}
{2: 'System', 3: 'M.I.N.D. stability for Construct BPH-22 has returned to normal.'}
{3: 'While you send a report to Command, No. 21 stands there silently as if someone had pressed pause. The sharp and drastic contrast from her previous frenzy seems incomprehensible.'}
{3: 'The wind and heartbeat in your ears begin to stabilize.'}
{2: 'System', 3: 'Threat removal confirmed by Command. ETE for the transport craft is twenty minutes. Remain in position and await extraction.'}
{3: "Hot wind carrying dust and smoke from the battle blows through No. 21's hair. While waiting for the transport craft, you both are surrounded by a peculiar silence."}
{2: 'Lose control back there?', 3: '96'}
{1: '1', 2: 'No. 21', 3: 'When I got here, the ground was already covered with bodies.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'No. 21', 3: 'I thought that the captain and Noctis might be among them...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'No. 21', 3: "And... that's when I saw them... The captain and Noctis... were there, too.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'No. 21', 3: "But now I know that it wasn't real. My vision module was confused.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'No. 21', 3: 'I just wanted to finish the mission. But when I was fighting... I lost control.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'No. 21', 3: 'Until you got here, 【kuroname】.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'She answers quickly, and then, as if noticing something, she sniffs quietly and kneels down.'}
{3: "Following her gaze, you see a broken nameplate among the pile of Corrupted remains. You can barely recognize that it belongs to Babylonia's Task Force."}
{1: '1', 2: 'No. 21', 3: "It doesn't belong to the captain or Noctis.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Does the nameplate belong to a human?', 3: '113'}
{3: 'No. 21 shakes her head.'}
{2: 'No. 21', 3: "It belongs to a Construct, but I don't smell any sign of life.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Even though you know that sacrifice is inevitable for soldiers, you are still overcome with grief.'}
{3: "No matter how many times you experience it, you still can't get used to such things, nor should you."}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png'}
{2: 'No. 21', 3: 'What are you doing?'}
{2: 'We will mourn the soldiers who died on the battlefield.'}
{2: 'No. 21', 3: "But even if we do, they won't know."}
{2: 'No. 21', 3: 'Why would you do it?'}
{2: "It's a way for us to say farewell.", 3: '127', 4: "They've given up their lives so that we can live.", 5: '127'}
{2: 'We must carry on their will to fight.', 3: '128'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory5.jpg'}
{2: "That's one of the reasons we continue to fight.", 3: '130'}
{2: 'No. 21', 3: 'All I know is war.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Thinking of Vera and Noctis lying on the ground...', 3: '134'}
{2: 'How did you feel?', 3: '135'}
{2: 'No. 21', 3: "I don't want to think about it.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'No. 21', 3: "I can't let that happen. So, I must fight.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Whoever this nameplate belonged to thought so as well.', 3: '139'}
{3: 'A gust of wind lifts the dust off the ground. The roar of the approaching transport craft can be heard nearby in the sky.'}
{3: "No. 21 looks at a nameplate buried in vital fluid and dirt. She felt the impulse to do something though she couldn't tell where it came from."}
{3: "Perhaps it was from the commandant's words and emotions, both of which were foreign to her, that had been shared over the link."}
{3: 'Perhaps it was human instinct that made it seem so important.'}
{3: 'She picks up the broken nameplate, then boards the transport craft.'}
